comments.body: move the toStringDeep tests for the entire errors to be the very last test in the test block. That way if a test fails, the person reviewing the failure will know that all the other checks have passed and the only difference was a slightly probably harmless delta in the toStringDeep. For example, if there was a refactor and one ancestor changed then this test could start failing at some point for a harmless reason.

This has just happened to me. Would the fix be to simply update the test with the latest error string? Or is it better to write this test in a different manner?

Context: I'm trying to update the default Material Page transition and I'm sure it caused some harmless difference here

@shihaohong  I wrote this test with the first fix that you mentioned in mind if there's any change made to the code. I figured that was the best way to test it since I had to write lot of test cases and I didn't have enough time to test it in a different manner. But if you feel like it's better to test in a different manner, please feel free to do so!
cmiiw? @jacob314
